text:
On a super hot evening in early July, a young guy stepped out of his tiny attic room in S. Place. He walked slowly, like he was unsure of himself, heading toward K. bridge.

He had just dodged his landlady on the stairs. His attic was basically a cupboard at the top of a five-story building. The landlady, who gave him meals and checked in on him, lived right below him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A young man hesitates as he leaves his cramped garret on a hot July evening.
